result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A Pocian was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard A Pocian is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard A Pocian was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.
  • Richard A Pocian was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.
Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment

Pursuant to the above stipulation, it is agree and therefore it is hereby ordered that the defendant's house arrest be modified for the following time and purposes listed;
1  the defendant may on Christmas Day go to Bethlehem Church service at 09:45 and is allowed to leave 15 minutes before and 15 minutes after service for travel
2  To go to the Social Security office of Wednesday December 30, 2015 at 01:30 for the purpose of appealing his denial on benefilts
3  Social service has indicated that after the holidays they will allow supervised visitation at Bridgeway on Tuesday at 04p.m. to 5p.m. and Thursday at 04:30 to 05:00. He is allowed to travel 15 minutes to his house and 15 minutes to return.4  Nikki Pocian is perminted to be added to a list of approved drivers
5  All other conditions remain the same

Addendum to conditions of bond:
1.  The defendant's wife is Nikki Cassabaum and she is added to the list of approved drivers as is her father John Cassabaum and Wayne Pocian
2.  The defendant wishes to go to the 9:45 service on Christmas day at Bethlehem Lutheran 1121 Georgia Avenue and is allowed to leave his house 15 minutes before service and 15 minutes after services.
3.  To go to social security on Wednesday December 30, 2015 at 01:30 for the sole purpose of filing his appeal
4.  After Christmas, Social services services propose that the defendant visit his daughter at Bridgeway on Tuesday at 04:00 to 05:00 and Thursdays between 04:30 and 06:00 under supervision of Social services.  The defendant will be permitted to leave his home 15 minutes ahead of the visitation and to return 15 minutes after the supervised visit
5.  All releases are for the reason specified in this stipulation and the prior bond requirement still apply
